alert.note: Alert for Garvin; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 5:48AM CDT until July 09 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Southern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Northeastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... Southwestern Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... Southeastern McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 645 AM CDT. * At 548 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Tribbey to 6 miles south of Asher to near Scullin, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ada, Sulphur, Wewoka, Stratford, Konawa, Byng, Maud, Roff, Stonewall, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Francis, Fitzhugh, St. Louis, Sasakwa, Hickory, Macomb, and Scullin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Garvin; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
